article.headline: Arkansas 96, North Texas 61
article.story: FAYETTEVILLE, Ark. (AP) -- Arkansas scored the most points they've ever put up under coach Stan Heath in a 96-61 victory over North Texas on Saturday. Arkansas (8-3) had four players in double figures with Ronnie Brewer leading the Razorbacks with 14 points and Billy Pharis equaling his season-high, finishing with 12. Frustrated by Arkansas defense, North Texas (4-7) had 23 turnovers, compared to three for the Razorbacks, which is the team's low under Heath. Rashard Sullivan sparked an early 18-2 Arkansas run that Pharis capped with a 3-pointer to give the Razorbacks a 20-7 lead. Sullivan started the run with a pair of dunks, the second of which was a one-handed rebound follow. Matt Jones saw his first action of the season, just three days after leading the Arkansas football team to a win in the Independence Bowl, and finished with two point3 �@ric Ferguson put up 11 and had 8 assists for Arkansas. Leonard Hopkins and Jerome Rogers led North Texas with 12 points each. The game was the final non-conference match of the season for Arkansas, which opens Southeastern Conference play on Tuesday at home against LSU.
